reviews.review_msg: Although not the most hardworking prof (recycled lecture slides), he really cares about his students. He took all questions, and responded to feedback. He was gracious about marks and responded to emails quickly. He would be 5/5 if he taught more effectively.

Horrible Prof, has no idea what's going on, wastes time, doesn't teach the slides, just tells you to read them at home, when asked a question, he generally doesn't know the answer, so he replies with some off-topic thing, or asks you a question.
He expects you to study and learn by yourself, his midterms are fair and final exams fairly marked.
Very average experience and decent prof. Exams were tough to finish on time but it was curved nicely.
She is TERRIBLE at TEACHING. Her lectures are so uselss cuz she just repeat the achienve videos. Her tests are so hard SO GL.

She is only there for research. Often offers class chance to come down and witness her research, goes on tangents about it during class. Exams ridiculously hard given fact her lectures are useless. Expects a great deal of previous knowledge and is shocked when students 'dont get it'. Averages in the class were very low. Final was easy, however.

Horrible prof, not very helpful at all. Avoid her class if at all possible. The only way I got by was through the textbook. Her teaching style is unclear, she teaches the entire thing from powerpoint, and her tests are ridiculously difficult. Definitely recommend staying away from her!
Worst prof possible, she stinks at teaching, super hard exams, you learn nothing from the lectures. Okay as a person, horrible as a professor
Bernd is a great lecturer and was really good at answering student questions. Plus, Cookie Dough (pet rabbit) is bomb.
Crazy hard multiple choice exam questions (due to Covid??) but you can make up in written problems. I totally panicked, but grades turned out OK!
One of the better Profs at SFU. Makes online exams super hard, which is a bit scary but scales them. Lots of powerpoint. Does nice demos and has a cute bunny. Would take class again.

My man Bernd scales so beautifully. Oh you got 35% on that exam? Haha not anymore my friend that's a 55% now. You're at a B+? Nah bro you get an A. Hard course, lectures arent great, but who cares when you got Bernd helping ya out. GOAT

30 online hmwrk Qs due every week. 3 written hmwrks total. 3 pre-lectures per week. Exams are mostly based on tutorials. He's a nice guy but I never understood anything explained in lectures. Study the tutorials for exams and you'll do fine, especially since the tests are scaled quite a bit. You can also replace your worst exam with the your final.

He's a really nice guy, but not a great teacher. Lectures are pretty boring and don't have many hand written examples, but good demos. He's pretty disorganized with the online homework, but gave good intensions on it. Not bad, not great. He also has a cute bunny so that's a bonus.
All around there for the students, really appreciate his insight and kindness. Seems passionate about his own work as well. Hope to have him in the future.

Great teacher. He teaches in a manner that everyone should be able to grasp. Be prepared to take notes and ask questions. Go to office hours and ask all the questions you can. He makes hard exams, but they're exams that make you think. I enjoyed his class immensely.
He is the best prof I have met in this school

Extremely good at explaining things, I never left a lecture confused. Likes to trick students with i-Clicker questions and gives relatively hard homework, but the exams are fair, and he drops your lowest midterm. Great prof.

his assignments and exams are totally unrelated. theres was no point doing calculation problems because there was only one calculation question on the exam and it was okay. the class average for the midterm was 36% but its scaled.  still...i know ppl who didn't study at all who got a better mark than i did because they guessed on the exam.

Jeff is a good guy. Puts most of his notes online. Interesting in class demonstrations. HW is manageable and exams aren't too bad. Wasn't able to cover all the material in the course due to poor time management.

His notes are very clear and it looked as if spent a lot of time  making them.  His tests are quite difficult and multiple choice questions can be worth 3-4 marks.  Make sure you understand the concepts and you'll be fine.
what a great guy he is!
AN OUTSTANDING PROFESSOR!!! He is the BEST I have got this term.... the use of different colors in his drawings... its just shows how much efforts he puts in... he's just GREAT!

Generally a nice guy, good lectures.  Material in lectures was material on exams.  Assignments were very challenging.  Assignment marking was hard and near to unfair.  A lot of students came to final exam, wrote there name on the paper and left, but I didn't find the course too challenging.

He cares about everyone understanding so by the second midterm we were 6 lectures behind due to small questions derailing whole lectures. First midterm was really hard and most people failed, second midterm he put lots of bonus marks and made it relatively easy, final was curved and replaced my first midterm.
The first midterm average was below passing. There's a lot of online homework, the lectures were boring, and the course is generally just hard.

The timing of when we learned things was unorganized. Practice tests and lecture iClicker questions, and TA tutorials are useful. Homework isn't useful. I had to rely on my friends to teach me because I couldn't understand the professor's explanations. This class is really challenging, particularly if you're taking it concurrently with math.
Really helpful prof. Not that good at explaining material though he will try to make you understand
Soooo nice, will help you pass (Y)

Most of the time he would try and and prove equations, but he would forget how to do so. Get used to the saying "trust me". The final exam was out of 60. After the first hour he saw it was going terribly and said it was out of 55. When it was marked it was out of 50 and everyone was given an additional six bonus marks.
He wasn't clear while lecturing. I was even more confused after lectures then before. Didn't explain format of exams, emails answering questions were unclear. Not a good profersor at all!

not an easy grader. tests are usually from homework or tutorial problems but the hardest ones from there. so u wont see anything unusual but definitely practice them. also very repetitive on questions so previous year papers are a way to go too

Thanks to professor Michael Chen, I have finally received my credit for physics 121 on my second attempt! He curved grades in the end allowing me to pass with a c-! Failed the final with a 32% and still passed! Michael Chen THE G.O.A.T

Michael Chen is the goat that's all that needs to be said. Fair midterms and fair final, you will never see anything beyond the scope of the material seen in class, homework and tutorials. This class is purely effort dependent. Also, Michael is a funny, he played the piano before a midterm to get us ready. Lectures are dry though, not gonna lie.
he's nice
Amazing, plain and simple.

This content in this class is not straightforward and I think I would have failed if I didn't have Micheal as a prof. Super excellent lecture with hilarious jokes, exams are fair, and the grading scheme is evenly distributed. Pay attention to the tutorials and any lecture problems he goes over! Highly highly recommend this prof!
Michael literally copies and pastes multiple choice questions from lecture slides and homework problems directly onto exams. Easy peasy marks. Absolute GOAT. Take a class with him if you can!

Phys 121 is a super tough course. Michael Chen is a decent professor. Mostly because he always wears the drippiest clothing, he's a 50-year-old that looks like a 2010s doll boy. Though he marks iclickers on correctness and the iclicker + achieve is worth over 20% of your mark so its tough. The midterm exam was super easy though, so all evens out.

Good teacher overall, lectures might feel boring but he does explain ideas very well. Uses iclicker questions to keep people engaged in lectures. Exams contain standard physics questions with no surprises. Actively tries to maximize your grade by offering a choice between multiple grading schemes.
Best prof at SFU - he genuinely wants his students to succeed. Uses smartphysics, and explains the concepts very well. Always helpful with assignments, and any questions you have.
Hilarious and nice teacher! :)

PHYS 121 is a HARD class but Haljan makes it so much more bearable. He's incredibly accessible and is super engaging in lectures, and I actually enjoyed attending them. You can also tell he knows what he's doing. If physics isn't your thing, take a class with him!

Best physics Prof I've ever had. His lectures are really clear with lots of examples so I would recommend going as it makes the material much easier to understand. The exams are hard but very reasonable compared to some other physics exams I've taken. 100% want him to teach all my science courses.

Extremely amazing prof and one of the more caring ones. He gets really excited during demos and whenever people get iclicker questions right. Would definitely recommend to people taking a physics class!

Great professor. I had heard nightmares about E&M physics but Paul made it a very clear and reasonable experience. Most fair midterms I've ever seen from a class, highly resembling the homework with the odd challenge. Used SmartPhysics which, unlike mastering physics, is actually useful. If i had to take more physics Id definitely take em with Paul

Nice prof! Polite and clear. To my surprise for this course you got problems solved in lectures not tutorials.  i clicker questions are important since some of the exam problems are based on them.  Smart physics sucks, you just get judged wrong by the system. Though before every lecture haljan will show comments, most of them are quite funny :)
He's cool :D
He is a great professor and good at relating material in class to current real world applications.

Dr. Haljan strikes me as someone who never lost the excitement from middle school when they first find out that lasers are a real thing. He is enthusiastic, moreso than I've seen from any other professors at SFU so far. It is contagious and made this course an absolute pleasure.  PHYS 255 when he next teaches it, even though it's not needed for me
He's great, he may seem nervous at first but I thought he was pretty good at explaining and his applications of experiments was cool. He made the course more interesting than it really is.

I loved this Dr Haljan. He's hilarious and tried to make every class fun by doing a lot of live demonstrations! He's kind of a strange man yet charismatic and he chuckles at everything and gets really excited when he does the in class demonstrations. The iClicker questions in class are usually easy and he's pretty clear when he speaks. Great prof.
he can not teach
He's cute.great prof
His lectures are fine but the exams are horrible.
He was always super enthusiastic but he is new and not the best prof. He rambles on and some of the midterms are very hard and unrelated to the emphasized material.

Amazing Prof.  He explains material very clearly, and I understand most of the material after hearing his lectures.  I have never been very interested in Electricity and Magnetism, but he made the class interesting.  He's also very friendly and willing to help after class.

He is interested in the material, interested in our learning, and responsive to the fact that we had other classes than just Phys 121. What more could you ask for in a prof? Amir is awesome and re-engaged my interest in physics.
"Preaches" physics to you. Very clear and precise. No way you're going to fall asleep. Can't go wrong. Get in his class like you're going to a concert.
The nicest prof I had so far
this was the first class that he taught and he did a great job. his marking was very fair and his lectures were very insightful. strongly suggested for phys 121

Had him for this course back in Spring '04. As other posters have said, the material as presented (clearly printed, though) looks deceptively simple. Homework is way tougher, and the exams are in between. He has quite the attitude problem when it comes to students and I avoided PHYS 385 because he was the one teaching it. I took CHEM 464 instead.
Class averages were below 50%, which he attributed solely to students.

This guy is no a nice person, just go try and talk to him, you will know what I mean.  He could not care less about the students.  He is not the hardest prof I have had, but he is defiantly the most unfriendly prof I have ever had.  I recommend you avoid him.
avoid him
The way he teaches makes the class seem so damn easy. But it isn't actually like that. Exams were a lot tougher than the hmwk. Do not study hmwk for exams, instead focus on concepts.
Not helpful and very unfreidly.  Notes well organized, exams hard.  Lets way too much cheating go on in his class.

no office hours.  does not like to answer questions. simplifies everything down to physics 12 level.  midterms are easy - but don't test you fully on what's important in the curriculum.  you're screwed if this is a prerequisite for something else
No Comments
Simple and easy. Not so interesting though. Can't really tell what he's thinking when he's smiling.
No Comments
told me not to stalk him.  no office hours.  boring stuck up voice.  does not care about students at all.  likes to make midterms have gaussian curves. I curse him and his gaussian curves.
Takes so much time w/ easy stuff but rushes through the hard stuff. Shy guy. Face gets all red when you ax him a Q.

Somebody actually say he is a good prof? This is unbelievable. Simple exams that does not mean anything. The whole purpose of an exam is to get a normal distribution curve out of it, whereas Hayden's exams actually mean something.
No Comments
No Comments
easy course, easy prof
No Comments
He's pretty good...easy midterm so far..unlike Hayden
I want to drop out
Good job and nice midterm, hopefully same trend will continue till end
SEXY AND COOL BUT VERY EASY EXAMS
No Comments
I want to cry, I want a way out
Very condescending when asking for explainations.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Great notes, but the tests were auful and he was the worst with helping
Seems like a good guy. Don't understand why you guys hate him.
he deserves better ratings!
stupidly hard tests.... no half marks?? class ave on midterm, 2.3/10?
didn't seem interested in what he was doing, look pissed off constantly
very clear....but very hard exams...
Doesn't offer any office hours.

he went through material too quickly. i did go to class but i couldnt focus..i went to play (sometimes sleep)~ he's a very easy marker..he scaled the class...although i failed both midterms (not badly fail..one of them was above average too~), i practiced hard and i got 80% for final exam~lol

Uses the textbook for homework questions. Provides powerpoint slides before class with full lecture notes. As such, he tends to go over them and talk about the key points in the notes instead of teaching you how not to do algebra. Very approachable and helpful if you go to his office hours.
too fast..he just skip through his slides and pick something to talk about....maybe he was trying to speedup..idk...i only attended 4 classes,2 of them were for midterms

So bad....dude, he just talks and he goes so fast with the course, going to class is useless, you don't learn anything, the tutorials are helpful, but the lectures are so bad....he's a funny guy but lectures are useless

Very difficult class (especially if you're not a phys, engineering student).  Good teacher, enjoyed going to class due to demos but he expects way too much from you.  Spent more hours/week on this class then any other and ended up doing the worst.  Avoid if possible.

Teaches fine but the class/prof expects way too much out of you.  I spent the most time on this class than any of my others and it still ended up being my worst mark.  Demos are very interesting but the exams are crazy hard.  Avoid this class if possible.
Very entertaining to watch in action, but the tests are tough if you don't work at it.

I absolutely do not agree with people saying that he teaches well in class. However, when it comes to one on one he's very helpful and patient... but unfortunately it does not make the exams easier for you even if you think you have bombarded him with a huge amount of questions... Conclusion, EVADE!

Hayden is pretty good at teaching our class. However, my hand was sore everytime I get out of the class (from the taking notes, and stop thinking dirty!). Exams are hard though, but I somehow nailed the first midterm, lol.
